Class Projectile

java.lang.Object
  




public class Projectile
extends greenfoot.Actor

A projectile is fired regularly by a shooter to hit enemies and kill them. If it hits an enemy, the enemy will take damage.

Version:
June 2018
Author:
Amber Chen

          Creates a projectile with a specified direction.

Constructor Detail

Projectile

public Projectile(int direction)
Creates a projectile with a specified direction.

Parameters:
direction - Rotation of the projectile; specifies which way projectile will move
Method Detail

act

public void act()
The projectile moves. If it hits an enemy, the enemy will take damage. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

atWorldEdge

public boolean atWorldEdge()
Determines if the Weapon is at the edge of the world. If so, remove the weapon.
